facultyName: Department of Sport, Health Sciences and Social Work
description: Nutrition is one of the most important factors contributing to human health. It’s an exciting and evolving field where your work could change lives and transform communities.We’re home to the renowned Oxford Brookes Centre for Nutrition and Health. You’ll have regular contact with top researchers throughout the course where you will hear the latest insights. Get involved in studies – as an assistant or work alongside them to gain key experience for your CV.
duration: 1 year full time, 2 years part time (MSc), 20 months part time (PgDip), 8 months part time (PgCert)
fees: Fees● Home (UK) full time - £9,300 ● Home (UK) part time - £4,650 ● International full time - £16,500
